pr_title: Feature/integrate new search page in selection section

timeline.message: Display new search ui in Selection Section.
Add the new search page entry files in 'entrybuild'.
Rename the ID of new search page DIV.
Fix a broken comment format for RootSearchSection.

Selection Section CSS styles tweaks

1. Make sure the new search UI display properly.
2. Also improve other pages and the LMS side panel.

Show new search page in Selection Section when the mode is
'structured'.

Improve the UI of Selection Section when it's in
'selectOrAdd' mode.
Create header for RenderNewSearchPage.scala

Ensure CSS changes made for Selection Section do not
apply to other UI pages

Remove MUI class name conflicts in production environment.

Loading NewSearchPage.tsx in Selection Section with New UI turned
on causes MUI class name conflicts. For example, there would be
two styles named 'jss1'. This can be fixed by using 'Class Name
generator' to differentiate styles.

Also display new search UI when Selection Session is in
NORMAL layout.

Ensure new search UI displays properly with the Two Column
Layout in Selection Session.

timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
After more digging I realised that there is no need to check what layout is used.
But to answer your question, there are three layouts: NORMAL, COURSE, SKINNY. So far, I have seen NORMAL and COURSE in selection session. Take Moodle as an example, if the openEQUELLA action is configured to use selectOrAdd then NORMAL is used, and if that's configured to use 'structured' then COURSE is used.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.message:
Remove folder 'entrydev' and rename 'entrybuild' to
'entrypoint'.

Update the js entry path used in 'package.json' and
'tsconfig.json'.

Let the default function of 'index.tsx' take an argument
which indicates where the function is called.

Update the html and ts files under 'entrypoint'

1. Each html file now has their own ts file.
2. Each ts file calls the default function of 'Index.tsx' with
a string literal argument.
Use 'runtypes' to determine what component should be rendered.
Use 'runtypes' to match the entry JS file

More Css work for selection session

1. Make sure all pages have consistent horizontal margin by reusing
pre-defined variable '$doubleMargin'.

2. Improve the LMS side panel in Normal layout.

3. Adjust the width of contribution page.

4. Add comments to explain the purposes of some styles.
Refactor the logic of generating contents of AbstractRootSearchSection.
Override the CSS of 'mainCols' and 'col2' in different contexts.

Update how to render new search UI in selection
session.

The previous approach results in unnecessary DOM tree
differences: in COURSE layout new search UI is just under
'selection-content-inner' whereas in NORMAL layout it is
under 'selection-content-inner/mainCols/col1'. This commit
ensure the DOM tree keeps consistent. By doing this, some
CSS styles made previously can be removed.
Remove unused imports in RootSearchSection
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page-in-selection-section' into feature/integrate-new-search-page-in-selection-section
Use the pinned version of 'runtypes'.
Wrap component IndexPage by ThemeProvider in App.tsx.

Reuse sass mixin 'curvedCorners' in CSS class 'box_head'
and 'box_content'.

A couple tweaks for 'App.tsx'.

1. Rename 'page' to 'children' for 'NewPageProps' and update
how 'children' is passed into 'NewPage'.
2. Rename function 'emptyFunc' to 'nop'.
Move the compiled 'uploadlist.js' to the correct target folder.
Clean up the NPM scripts for Parcel build/watch.

Update react route to ensure new search UI displays
properly in Selection Session.

Revert "Update react route to ensure new search UI displays"

This reverts commit 7e9f5f3e6d38383680ba7a2bfc3f1d7eb3c22553.

Support accessing Legacy Search page through
'/access/selectoradd/searching.do'.

The intention of this commit is to differentiate the URL
used to access the old Search UI from Selection Session.
With the changes made in #2414, once New Search UI is enabled,
'searching.do' will be captured by react-route, which results
in incorrect contents of Search page displayed in Selection
Session. Therefore, we need to have a new URL to access old
Search page in Selection Session.
Reuse mixin 'buttonShadowBorder' for CSS class 'box'.

Remove unneeded prefix from the URL used to access
old Search UI in 'selectoradd' mode.

timeline.bodyText:

I can't think of any specific examples, but it might be safe to check if the new UI is enabled before using this path?
